body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govr. of Kentucky

Your petitioner Edwd Hall Sr father of Edwd S Hall who is a minor, would respectfully represent that his son about Christmas times had a pistol about his person in company with other youths & was presented & fined fifty dolls. in the city court of Louisville. the father says he replevied the Debt to Keep his son out of the workhouse & which will be due in a few days but that in consequence of the hard times & his business almost entirely stopped (which is a sadler) he is wholly unable to pay having a large family to support the youth has heretofore conducted himself in a orderly & modest manner & will not again I am sure offend agst. the law I pray yr Excellency to remit his fine & I will ever pray &c

Respectfully yr obt Servt
Edwd Hall
We would most respectfully ask yr Excellency to remit young Halls fine of fifty dolls the costs are penalty enough respectfully yr obt servt

John Joyes
W. G. Reasor
O H Strattan Clk C C
W R Hydes Marshall C C L
T H Crawford Mayor
D W Wilson
To His Excellency the Govener of Kentucky

I am well acquainted with Mr Hall the father of the boy against whom the fine ^is^ imposed. I know nothing of the particulars: Mr Hall is one of our oldest citizens and much esteemed by his old friends. He is somewhat embarassed, with a large family and to pay the fine of his son will be very hard upon him I hope if consistent with Executive clemency it may be remitted --
I prosecuted in the above case but do not now remember the particulars of the case. I heartily concur with Mr Craig, as to the good character of the father of young Hall

Remitted
B. M
Louisville City Ct
$50. } Weapons
Ed. S. Hall
Issd. Apr 9. 1861
